title: How to Make Cranberry Sauce

steps.headline: Rinse and clean cranberries.
steps.description: Empty a bag of cranberries into a colander, and rinse thoroughly, removing any leaves, stems etc.

steps.headline: Bring water and sugar to boil.
steps.description: Stir continuously, working around the edges to make sure all the sugar is dissolved.

steps.headline: Remove from heat and add the cranberries.
steps.description: Stir, and return to boil. If you are adding optional ingredients, now is the time. (see "Tips").

steps.headline: Reduce heat.
steps.description: Simmer sauce gently as the cranberries pop open. This will take around 5 to 12 minutes.

steps.headline: Let cool.
steps.description: If you want a completely chilled sauce, it will take about 2 and 1/2 hours in your refrigerator.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Cranberry sauce is usually presented in a small, dainty and beautifully designed dish. Add a small spoon for self-serving.

steps.headline: Rinse and clean cranberries.
steps.description: Empty a bag of cranberries into a colander, and rinse thoroughly, removing any leaves, stems etc.

steps.headline: Blend the sugar and orange juice.
steps.description: Heat the orange juice over medium heat in a medium-sized saucepan, and stir in the sugar to blend. Stir continuously, working around the edges to make sure all the sugar is dissolved.

steps.headline: Add the cranberries.
steps.description: Stir and cook until the cranberries pop open. This will take around 5 to 12 minutes.

steps.headline: Let cool.
steps.description: Empty the cranberry sauce into a serving bowl, and allow to cool. If you want a completely chilled sauce, it will take about 2 and 1/2 hours in your refrigerator.

steps.headline: Sautee cranberries.
steps.description: Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat until it begins to shimmer. Add the cranberries and stir to coat, then add the chopped fresh ginger. Sauté, stirring frequently, until the cranberries pop open—about 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the wine.
steps.description: Stir in the wine, and then stir in the sugar, working around the edges with your spoon to make sure all the sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil.

steps.headline: Reduce the mixture.
steps.description: Let the mixture boil, uncovered, until has reduced by about 1/3 to 1/2—about 15 to 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the spices.
steps.description: Add the chopped crystallized ginger, curry, and 5-spice, and blend well.

steps.headline: Remove from heat.
steps.description: Let the sauce cool to the desired serving temperature, or refrigerate to chill for about 2-1/2 hours.

steps.headline: Garnish.
steps.description: Add a sprig of fresh tarragon or thin strips of orange peel to garnish.

text: Basic Cranberry Sauce Rinse and clean cranberries. Empty a bag of cranberries into a colander, and rinse thoroughly, removing any leaves, stems etc. Bring water and sugar to boil. Stir continuously, working around the edges to make sure all the sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and add the cranberries. Stir, and return to boil. If you are adding optional ingredients, now is the time. (see "Tips"). Reduce heat. Simmer sauce gently as the cranberries pop open. This will take around 5 to 12 minutes. Let cool. If you want a completely chilled sauce, it will take about 2 and 1/2 hours in your refrigerator. Serve. Cranberry sauce is usually presented in a small, dainty and beautifully designed dish. Add a small spoon for self-serving. Tart Cranberry Sauce Rinse and clean cranberries. Empty a bag of cranberries into a colander, and rinse thoroughly, removing any leaves, stems etc. Blend the sugar and orange juice. Heat the orange juice over medium heat in a medium-sized saucepan, and stir in the sugar to blend. Stir continuously, working around the edges to make sure all the sugar is dissolved. Add the cranberries. Stir and cook until the cranberries pop open. This will take around 5 to 12 minutes. Let cool. Empty the cranberry sauce into a serving bowl, and allow to cool. If you want a completely chilled sauce, it will take about 2 and 1/2 hours in your refrigerator. Serve and enjoy!  Spicy Cranberry Sauce Sautee cranberries. Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat until it begins to shimmer. Add the cranberries and stir to coat, then add the chopped fresh ginger. Sauté, stirring frequently, until the cranberries pop open—about 5 minutes. Add the wine. Stir in the wine, and then stir in the sugar, working around the edges with your spoon to make sure all the sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil. Reduce the mixture. Let the mixture boil, uncovered, until has reduced by about 1/3 to 1/2—about 15 to 20 minutes. Add the spices. Add the chopped crystallized ginger, curry, and 5-spice, and blend well. Remove from heat. Let the sauce cool to the desired serving temperature, or refrigerate to chill for about 2-1/2 hours. Garnish. Add a sprig of fresh tarragon or thin strips of orange peel to garnish.
